column4: Can anybody continue to help me with my problem?  Ubuntu boot hangs when more than 1 harddrive installed.
I have 2 hard drives on my setup and it worked fine
I am, and I'm thinking that might be having a negative effect on why it won't boot.  Maybe not.
so you have ubuntu installed, its just not booting ubuntu, or both os's
I have Ubuntu on a 20GB partition, WinXP MCE on a 50GB partition and a 4GB swap on my 74GB raptor.
Well it boots when I remove my other harddrives from the board.

when I instal the other drives (2x 160GB; 1 500GB) Ubuntu hangs at "Waiting for root filesystem."  After about 5 minutes, I get dropped to a shell with the following: "ALERT! /dev/sda5 does not exist."
when all the drives are installed, WinXP boots fine.
it's as if Ubuntu can't differentiate between the drives and doesn't know where the root filesystem is located when there is more than 1 drive.
Nobdy has any info as to why Ubuntu fails to load with multiple harddisks installed?  I'm dual-booting via GRUB.  WindowsXP boots fine.
so xp is /dev/hda1 I assume, can you boot into the livecd and see what options grub is using to try to boot ubuntu
I can do that. By "options grub is using," what should I keep an eye out for?
I mean you have to look at /etc/grub/menu.lst and see how it is trying to boot ubuntu
OK.  Give me a few minutes to boot up...
I will be cooking, so I will be in and out, you can pm me if you want, then I will see it for sure
outstanding.  thanks alot for your patience...
